rComments: okay, so obviously the people who have commented before me were the few couple of students who failed the class miserably! She is MUCH MUCH better as a professor than any actual professor! I cannot emphasize this enough..Take her class!!! Physics can be ridiculously complicated nd she makes it as easy as it can possibly get! plus gives you several

Her lectures are oversimplistic, the homework is ridiculously complicated, and the exams are laughable and often graded down severely due to minor mistakes. It's pretty obvious just from the first class that she's not even a professor. Try to avoid her if you can.

I've had Deva twice now. She is a very enthusiastic teacher and open. However, it is very apparent that she lacks experience--often making mistakes in the lectures. She could improve alot on providing students with more adept practice exams and homeworks. Besides her flaws from inexperience, she makes the class somewhat interesting..

For being a graduate student, Deva has far surpassed several of the ACTUAL professors that I have had. I went from hating Physics (due to a terrible prof) to understanding it, and being proud of my work. She teaches in a clear and concise manner, and gives students an abundance of examples for each section that she teaches.

There's no point in going to class because she sucks at teaching. You don't really learn anything in class, you're basically learning on your own. Don't take her unless you HAVE to take physics that quarter.
